page.title: 04THE BARONY OF FINZEAN.
page.content: In 1708 barony rights were granted to the laird of Finzean,in respect of the lands of Finzean,Balnaboth, Balnahard, Dalsack,Percie,Woodend,Balfiddy, Tillygarmont,Whitestone and the Mill of Clenter.Farms exist of these names today but Balnaboth, Dalsack and Woodend have been incorporated into Finzean Home farm and neighbouring {farms,larger units being more {economically viable.} The charter carried with it important {salmon fishing rights}on the River Dee which are still effective and have been tested in court. The barony is still intact although some small pieces of ground have been fued since the estate was disentailed in 1935. The family coat of arms still bears the insignia of the{feudal}baron.
